parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input feature class that will be used for calculating market penetration.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class that contains the calculated market penetration features.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field in the market penetration layer.

parameters.name: market_penetration_base_field
parameters.explanation: The field containing the values that will be used to calculate market penetration. This field will be used as the denominator and represents your market—for example, Total Population or Total Households.

parameters.name: in_customer_features
parameters.explanation:
The input feature class containing the points for the customer
layer.

parameters.name: area_description_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used to describe each feature in the market penetration layer.

parameters.name: weight_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field in the customer layer that will be used as a weight to calculate market penetration rather than customer counts.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies whether a summary report will be created.
CREATE_REPORT—A summary report will be created.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A summary report will not be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: store_id(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A unique identifier associated with each store for each trade area.

parameters.name: link_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: An ID that assigns a trade area to a customer.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output directory that will contain the report.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format  one or more output report formats.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.

tools.summary: Calculates the market penetration based on the number of customers within an area compared to a demographic variable such as total population. An optional report can be created detailing the market penetration.

parameters.name: classification_variable
parameters.explanation: A variable that will display as a color-coded map.

parameters.name: out_layer_name
parameters.explanation: The name of the color-coded layer that will be added to the map.

parameters.name: classification_method
parameters.explanation: Specifies the method that will be used to calculate  the class breaks.NATURAL_BREAKS—Natural breaks classes are based on natural groupings inherent in the data. Class breaks that best group similar values and maximize the differences between classes will be identified. This is the default.QUANTILE—Each class will contain an equal number of features. A quantile classification is well suited to linearly distributed data. EQUAL_INTERVAL—The range of attribute values will be divided into equal-sized subranges. This allows you to specify the number of intervals and  will automatically determine the class breaks based on the value range.STD_DEV—  Class breaks will be placed above and below the mean value at a specified interval size, such as 2, 1, or 0.5, in the unit of standard deviation, until reaching the minimum and maximum values of the input variable.GEOMETRIC_INTERVAL—Class breaks will be created based on class intervals that have a geometric series. The geometric coefficient in this classifier can change once (to its inverse) to optimize the class ranges.AUTO—Classification methods will be automatically defined using the variable metadata. This presents the recommended thematic map style based on the data type.

parameters.name: number_of_classes
parameters.explanation: The number of data classification breaks that will appear on the map. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: area_of_interest(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The feature layer that will be used to determine the geographic extent of the analysis.

parameters.name: out_dataset_path(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The geodatabase in which the output feature dataset will be created.

parameters.name: out_dataset_name(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The name of the feature dataset in the output geodatabase in which the color-coded layer feature classes will be created.

parameters.name: boundary_mode(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the types of boundaries that will be used to create levels in the color-coded group layer.STANDARD_GEOGRAPHIES—Boundaries will be levels of standard geographies. This is the default.H3_HEXAGONS—Boundaries will be levels of H3 hexagons.

parameters.name: secondary_variable(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A second variable that will display as a color-coded map.

parameters.name: grid_size(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the grid size that will be used to create the bivariate color symbology.TWO_BY_TWO—A 4-class bivariate color scheme will be used.THREE_BY_THREE—A 9-class bivariate color scheme will be used. This is the default.FOUR_BY_FOUR—A 12-class bivariate color scheme will be used.

parameters.name: renderer_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of symbology that will be used.BIVARIATE—Two variables will be displayed using a grid color scheme.GRADUATED_COLORS—Varying color shades will be displayed across geographical areas. This is the default.GRADUATED_SYMBOLS—Varying symbol sizes will be displayed across geographical areas.

tools.summary: Creates multilevel, scale-dependent choropleth layers from a variable describing a business, demographic, consumer, or landscape characteristic.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The features that will be enriched.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output layer containing both the input attributes and user-selected attributes. Selected attributes are summarized from underlying demographic boundaries. Only the area inside the input boundary is considered.

parameters.name: variables[variables,...]
parameters.explanation: The variables that will be summarized and added to the output feature class.

parameters.name: buffer_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies the area that will be enriched.
The default value is STRAIGHT_LINE_DISTANCE.Input line features can only use the STRAIGHT_LINE_DISTANCE distance option.

parameters.name: distance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance or size of an area to enrich, for example, a 1-mile buffer or 5-minute walk time. Units correspond to the polygon type. The default value is 1.

parameters.name: unit(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The units associated with the distance parameter. The default value is MILES.

tools.summary: Enriches data by adding demographic and landscape facts about the people and places that surround or are inside data locations. The output is a duplicate of the input with additional attribute fields. This tool requires an ArcGIS Online organizational account or a locally stored or installed dataset. This tool uses detailed aggregation and apportionment settings to summarize data.  The Apportion Polygon tool is similar to this tool. However, Apportion Polygon uses user-specified apportionment. Enrich Layer uses U.S. Census Block points or global settlement points for apportionment. For more information, see Data apportionment.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The point layer to be measured to or from the in_location_points parameter value.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.explanation: A field containing unique identifiers for each input feature.

parameters.name: in_location_points
parameters.explanation: The layer that will be used to generate the output with distance and direction attributes to or from the in_features parameter value.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output location point features.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The calculated distance based on the method of travel. Straight Line is the default value.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The measurement units, in distance or time, that will be used when calculating nearby locations.

parameters.name: distance_limit(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The analysis extent measured in distance or time.

parameters.name: number_limit
parameters.explanation: The numeric limit of the in_location_points value.

parameters.name: percent_limit
parameters.explanation: The closest points, as a percentage of the points of the in_location_points value.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether an output report will be created.CREATE_REPORT—A report will be created.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A report will not be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the output report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The directory that will contain the output report.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output report formats. The default value is InfographicHTML. Additional available formats are PDF, XLSX, S.XLSX, HTML, S.XML, ZIP, CVS, PAGX, and InfographicPDF.

parameters.name: report_fields[report_fields,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The additional fields that will be added to the report.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether travel times or distances will be measured from location points to input features or from input features to location points.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from location points to input features. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from input features to location points.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time at which travel will begin.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used. Choose this option if you want the best location for a specific time, such as now, but aren't certain of the time zone in which the in_location_points value will be located.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the in_location_points value is located will be used. If the travel direction is input features to location points, this is the time zone of the input features. If the travel direction is location points to input features, this is the time zone of the location points. This is the default.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network. Points located beyond the search tolerance will be excluded from processing.

parameters.name: location_name(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A field from the input in_location_points parameter. This field contains the name or ID for each input point used in the Find Nearby Locations report.

tools.summary: Identifies locations closest to the input features based on a selected distance type. The number of points in the output is defined by limiting the count or percentage of location points to return or by limiting the distance from the input points.

parameters.name: in_stores_layer
parameters.explanation: The input point layer representing store or facility locations.

parameters.name: in_customers_layer
parameters.explanation: The input point layer representing customers or patrons.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The resultant feature class that will be added to the Contents pane.

parameters.name: store_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field representing a store or facility location.

parameters.name: link_field
parameters.explanation: An ID field used to assign individual customers to stores.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used for distance calculation. Straight Line is the default value. When using Portal for ArcGIS or local data sources, travel mode options are dynamically populated.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The type of distance- or time-measuring units that will be used when calculating minimal distance.

parameters.name: cutoff(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance beyond which customers will be considered outliers and excluded from consideration during desire line generation.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies the direction of travel that will be used between stores and demand points.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from demand points to stores.
This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from stores to demand points.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time at which travel begins.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used. Choose this option if you want to choose the best location for a specific time, such as now, but aren't certain in which time zone the stores or demand points are located.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the stores or demand points are located will be used. If travel_direction is AWAY_FROM_STORES, this is the time zone of the stores. If travel_direction is TOWARD_STORES, this is the time zone of the demand points. This is the default.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a Wind Rose report will be created.CREATE_REPORT—A report will be created.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A report will not be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the Wind Rose report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output directory that will contain the Wind Rose report.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: One or more output report formats. The default value is PDF. Additional available formats are XLSX, HTML, CSV, and PAGX.

tools.summary: Generates a series of lines from each customer to an associated store location. These lines are often called spider diagrams. The tool can also generate an optional Wind Rose report from the output. Note:This tool is similar to the Generate Origin-Destination Links tool in the Analysis toolbox Proximity toolset.

parameters.name: area_of_interest
parameters.explanation: The input feature class that will be used to define the extent of the grid or hexagon layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The feature class that will contain the grid or hexagon features.

parameters.name: cell_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the cell type that will be created in the output.SQUARE—Regular four-sided polygons with equal side lengths will be created. This is the default.HEXAGON—Regular six-sided polygons with equal side lengths will be created.H3_HEXAGON—Regular six-sided polygons with equal side lengths based on H3: Uber's hexagonal hierarchical spatial index will be created.

parameters.name: enrich_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the method that will be used for variable enrichment.ENRICH_CELL—Enrichment will be performed on the cell_type parameter value.ENRICH_BUFFER—Enrichment will be performed on a buffer around the centroid of the grid or hexagon.

parameters.name: cell_size(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The size of the cell to generate squares or hexagons. The default value is 1 square mile.

parameters.name: h3_resolution(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The resolution that will be used to generate the H3 hexagons. A value of 15 represents the finest resolution. The default value is 7.

parameters.name: variables[variables,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: A list of variables that will be appended to the output.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the method of travel that will be used for the buffer calculation.

parameters.name: distance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance that will be used for the buffer calculations.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The units that will be used for the distance parameter.

parameters.name: out_enriched_buffers(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The feature class that will contain the enriched buffers.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel that will be used between the center of the cell and the buffer boundary.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from location points to input features. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from input features to location points.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time at which the travel will begin.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used. Choose this option if you want the best location for a specific time, such as now, but aren't certain of the time zone.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the area_of_interest value is located will be used. This is the default.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network. Points located beyond the search tolerance will be excluded from processing.

parameters.name: polygon_detail(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the level of detail that will be used for the output drive time polygons. STANDARD—The optimal setting that combines processing speed with overall accuracy will be used. This is the default.GENERALIZED—The fastest method will be used.HIGH—The highest level of detail will be used.

parameters.name: out_centroids(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The feature class that will contain the cell centroids.

tools.summary: Creates features with vector-based square grid cells, hexagons, or H3 hexagons for a given area.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class that will contain the returned businesses.

parameters.name: in_search_features(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The area that will be used to search for businesses. Selected features supersede the feature class and will be used as the search area.

parameters.name: search_terms(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The terms that will be used to search for businesses. You can use terms such as business name or business type keywords. If this parameter is not set, all businesses from the in_search_features parameter value will be returned.

parameters.name: exact_match(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether only the text provided for the search_terms parameter will be returned from the search.EXACT_MATCH—Only exact matches to the text provided for the search_terms parameter will be returned.PARTIAL_MATCH—Partial matches to the text provided for the search_terms parameter as well as exact matches will be returned. This is the default.

parameters.name: match_name_only(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether the search will be limited to the business name only.MATCH_NAME_ONLY—Only exact matches to the business name provided for the search_terms parameter will be returned.MATCH_ALL_FIELDS—Partial matches to the business name provided for the search_terms parameter as well as exact matches will be returned. This is the default.

parameters.name: filters[[filter_name, filter_value, include],...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The filters that will be applied to the search_terms parameter.filter_name—Set the filter by the dataset field.filter_value—Set the filter by applying a value to the selected field.include—Set the filter by including or excluding field values.

parameters.name: max_count(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
The limit for the number of returned 
features. The default value is 1,000,000 for local data and 5,000 for online data hosted by ArcGIS Online.The record limit when using
on-premises hosted data is set by your administrator.

parameters.name: business_dataset(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The dataset that will be used in the business search.

parameters.name: find_related_poi
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether semantic search will be used to find related items to the search terms.FIND_RELATED_POI—Semantic search will be used.IGNORE_RELATED_POI—Semantic search will not be used. This is the default.

parameters.name: style(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the point symbology that will be used for the output feature class.Location—The data will be displayed using a single symbol. This is the default.Place—The data will be displayed using thematic symbols.

tools.summary: Generates a point feature layer from a business point location search.

parameters.name: in_facility_features
parameters.explanation: An input point feature layer representing existing facility locations. It is the first feature from the layer or the feature selected when a selection is available.

parameters.name: facility_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field for existing facilities.

parameters.name: in_candidate_features
parameters.explanation: An input point feature layer representing new candidate facility locations. It is the first feature from the layer or the feature selected when a selection is available.

parameters.name: candidate_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field for candidate facilities.

parameters.name: in_sales_potential_features
parameters.explanation: An input point or polygon feature layer used to calculate the sales potential. It is either all features from a layer or only selected features when a selection is available.

parameters.name: sales_potential_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field for sales potential features.

parameters.name: sales_potential_field
parameters.explanation: The field containing the values that will be used to calculate the sales potential.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class that will contain the tool results representing the probability of sales.

parameters.name: attractiveness_variables[[existing_facilities_value, candidates_location_value, exponent],...]
parameters.explanation:
The attribute fields that indicate the attractiveness of each competitor. In many cases, the size of the facility is used as a substitute for attractiveness and will be a multivalue table. An additional attractiveness variable is needed. The attractiveness field must be present in the existing facilities (competitors) and the candidate facilities layer.
existing_facilities_value—Numeric field in the in_facility_features parameter layer that represents attractiveness.candidates_location_value—Numeric field in the in_candidate_features parameter layer that matches the attractiveness value from the in_facility_features parameter layer. Distance does not require a matching field.exponent—The value that determines how much of a factor the variable is to the attractiveness value. The default value is 1.

parameters.name: distance_exponent
parameters.explanation: The distance exponent is generally a negative number because attractiveness decreases when distance increases. The default value is -1.5.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The type of distance, based on method of travel, that will be used. The default value is Straight Line.

parameters.name: distance_units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance-measuring units that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: out_distance_matrix(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The name and location of the matrix table of distance calculations. The IDs for the in_facility_features and in_candidate_features parameters must be unique.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel that will be used between stores and sales potential features.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from sales potential features to stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from stores to sales potential features.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

tools.summary: Creates a probability surface to predict the sales potential of an area based on distance and an attractiveness factor.

parameters.name: in_facility_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature class representing competitors or existing stores.

parameters.name: facility_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field representing a store or facility location.

parameters.name: in_customer_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature class representing customer locations.

parameters.name: link_field
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used as an ID to assign individual customers to a facility or store.

parameters.name: in_sales_potential_features
parameters.explanation: The input polygon feature class used to determine the potential sales market.

parameters.name: sales_potential_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field representing the sales potential area.

parameters.name: out_calibration
parameters.explanation: The output calibration file that will contain the calibrated Huff model results, which is the exponent values for the attractiveness variables and distance. The output file extension will be *.huffmodel.

parameters.name: attractiveness_variables[attractiveness_variables,...]
parameters.explanation:
The fields that will be used to determine the attractiveness of each competitor. In many
cases, the size of the store is used as a substitute for
attractiveness.

parameters.name: customer_weight_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A calculated weighted value field assigned to each customer.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used to calculate distance. The default value is Straight Line.

parameters.name: distance_units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance-measuring units that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel that will be used between stores and sales potential features.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from sales potential features to stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from stores to sales potential features.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

tools.summary: Calculates exponent values for use in the Huff Model tool.

parameters.name: online_report_template_id
parameters.explanation: The report template ID.

parameters.name: output_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The local folder where the report template items will be imported.

parameters.name: dataset_id(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The dataset that will be used to populate the report variables.

parameters.name: config(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A JSON string specifying where the report's SDCX variables will be stored. The config options are as follows:id—The portal item ID of the SDCX.download—True or false. Set to true to download the SDCX, or set to false to reference an existing SDCX.path—The location of the SDCX. Use an empty string to use the existing default—for example, the report output folder location—or specify a new folder location or an existing folder that contains the SDCX.name—The name of the SDCX. Specify a new name for the SDCX or the name of an existing SDCX.

tools.summary: Imports an online report so that it can run locally using a locally installed ArcGIS Business Analyst dataset. This tool is the underlying engine that runs the Import Template interactive workflow from the Catalog pane. This tool is ideal for performing more advanced automated tasks, such as importing templates through Python scripting or programmatically modifying data paths. The Import Template workflow will run the tool in the background and add its information to the Geoprocessing history.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The boundary layer containing one or more polygons that will be used to create reports.

parameters.name: report_templates[report_templates,...]
parameters.explanation: One or more report templates that will be used to create the summary report. You must be signed in to ArcGIS Online or have Business Analyst Data installed.

parameters.name: reports_folder
parameters.explanation: The output location where the summary reports will be saved.

parameters.name: summarization_options(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies how the data will be displayed in a report.INDIVIDUAL_FEATURES—Selected report templates will be returned for each individual trade area polygon. This is the default.WHOLE_LAYER—Selected report templates will be returned representing only the full extent of the trade area.BOTH_FEATURES_AND_LAYER—Selected report templates will be returned for both individual features and the whole layer.

parameters.name: single_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a single output will be created or a separate file will be created for each report.CREATE_SINGLE_REPORT—All reports will be combined into a single output.CREATE_REPORT_PER_TEMPLATE—A separate file will be created for each selected report. This is the default.

parameters.name: formats[formats,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The report output format. The default value is PDF.

parameters.name: store_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used to group data for each site in output reports. These field values are not displayed in the header.

parameters.name: store_name_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field values that will be displayed in the output report headers that identify the site corresponding to each polygon's data.

parameters.name: store_address_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The store address associated with each trade area.

parameters.name: store_latitude_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will contain the latitude coordinates (y field).

parameters.name: store_longitude_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will contain the longitude coordinates (x field).

parameters.name: ring_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will control the presentation order of data for inputs with multiple polygons per site.

parameters.name: area_description_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will be displayed as the output template header with values corresponding to each input polygon's data.

parameters.name: title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title in the report header.

parameters.name: subtitle(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The subtitle in the report header. The default value is Prepared by Business Analyst Pro.

parameters.name: report_per_feature(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a single report or multiple reports will be created.CREATE_REPORT_PER_FEATURE—A report will be created for each feature.CREATE_SINGLE_REPORT—A single report will be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: add_infographic_header(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a header will be added to the infographic.ENABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_HEADER—A header will be added to the infographic.DISABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_HEADER—A header will not be added to the infographic. This is the default.

parameters.name: add_infographic_footer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a footer will be added to the infographic.ENABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_FOOTER—A footer will be added to the infographic.DISABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_FOOTER—A footer will not be added to the infographic. This is the default.

parameters.name: add_infographic_data_source(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether the data source will be added to the infographic.ENABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_DATA_SOURCE—The data source will be added to the infographic.DISABLE_INFOGRAPHIC_DATA_SOURCE—The data source will not be added to the infographic. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_style(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the style that will be used for the Esri report.CLASSIC—The generated Esri report will use the traditional style. This is the default.MODERN—The generated Esri report will use the updated style.

tools.summary: Creates infographic and summary reports for a boundary layer using standard or custom templates.

parameters.name: sdcx_file
parameters.explanation: The input Statistical Data Collection file (.sdcx).

tools.summary: Creates an index for a Statistical Data Collection (SDCX). The index will improve performance when using the custom data in analysis tools such as Enrich Layer.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis layer that will be used in the analysis.

parameters.name: fields[fields,...]
parameters.explanation: The numeric fields from which the suitability criteria will be determined.

tools.summary: Adds criteria based on the numerical fields existing in the input layer.

tools.tool_name: Add Point Layer Based Suitability Criteria

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis layer that will be used in the analysis.

parameters.name: site_layer_id_field
parameters.explanation: A field containing unique values for each record in the Suitability Analysis layer.

parameters.name: in_point_features
parameters.explanation: The layer containing point locations that will be added as criteria based on the spatial relationship to the Suitability Analysis layer.

parameters.name: criteria_type
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of spatial relationship that will be used as criteria.COUNT—A count of points that fall within each Suitability Analysis layer polygon will be used as criteria. This is the default.WEIGHT—Field-weighted criteria of points that fall within each Suitability Analysis polygon based on the user-selected statistical type will be used as criteria.MINIMAL_DISTANCE—The distance from the closest point to each of the Suitability Analysis layer centroids will be used as criteria.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used to calculate the minimal distance.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The unit of measure that will be used when calculating minimal distance.

parameters.name: in_site_centers_features(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The point layer that will be used as site centers. This point layer will replace default polygon centroids of the Suitability Analysis layer.

parameters.name: site_centers_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A field in the in_site_centers_features parameter value that uniquely identifies each record.

parameters.name: weight_field
parameters.explanation: Numeric fields that exist in a point layer that will be selected for weighting.

parameters.name: statistics_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of statistical operation that will be applied to the weighted field.SUM—The total of the field values will be calculated for each point feature.AVE—The average field value will be calculated for each point feature.STD_DEV—The standard deviation of the field values will be calculated for each point feature.MIN—The smallest field value will be determined for each point feature.MAX—The largest field value will be determined for each point feature.

parameters.name: cutoff_distance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance beyond which points will not be considered in the calculation.

tools.summary: Adds criteria based on spatial relationships between the input layer and a specified point layer.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis layer that will be used in the analysis.

parameters.name: variables[variables,...]
parameters.explanation: The variables from which the suitability criteria will be determined.

tools.summary: Adds criteria based on the values calculated for the input layer using the Enrich Layer tool.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis Layer that will be used in the analysis.

tools.summary: Calculates or recalculates a suitability score.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The feature layer that will be used in the creation of the Suitability Analysis layer.

parameters.name: layer_name
parameters.explanation: The name of the output Suitability Analysis layer that will be created.

parameters.name: out_dataset_path(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The geodatabase that will contain the output feature dataset.

parameters.name: out_dataset_name(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The name of the output feature dataset that will contain the collection of suitability analysis layer feature classes.

tools.summary: Creates a Suitability Analysis group layer for an input site's polygonal layer.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The suitability analysis layer from which criteria will be removed.

parameters.name: drop_criteria[drop_criteria,...]
parameters.explanation: A list of criteria to be removed from a suitability analysis layer.

tools.summary: Removes criteria from a suitability analysis layer.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis layer that will be used in the analysis.

parameters.name: criteria_properties[[criterion, title, weight, influence, ideal_value, minimum_value, maximum_value, enabled],...]
parameters.explanation:
The input features that will be used to set up the criteria properties.criterion—The field, point, or variable that will be used to calculate the suitability score.title—The name of the criteria.weight—The influence a criteria value has on the overall suitability score.
The number must be greater than or equal to 0.influence—An example of a positive influence is as follows: You want a site to score higher if it has a greater number of households holding graduate or professional degrees. An example of an inverse influence is as follows: A lower median home value is more desirable, as it is indicative of greater home affordability. An example of an ideal influence is a search for areas within a range of values.POSITIVE—The higher the criteria value, the higher the suitability score.INVERSE—The lower the criteria value, the higher the suitability score.IDEAL—The closer to the ideal value, the higher the suitability score.TARGET—The closer to the target value, the higher the suitability score.ideal_value—The closer the criteria value is to the ideal value, the higher the suitability score.minimum_value—A numeric value that sets a hard limit for the criteria lower bound.maximum_value—A numeric value that sets a hard limit for the criteria upper bound.enabled—Use a value of true to include the criteria in the final suitability score.

parameters.name: criteria_score_preset(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the preprocessing and combination method that will be used when calculating the final score.SUM_SCALED—The sum of scaled values with scores representing the distribution of values for each criterion will be used. This is the default.GEOMEAN_SCALED—The geometric mean of the scaled values will be used.CUSTOM—User-defined preprocessing and combination methods will be used.

parameters.name: preprocessing(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies the method that will be used to convert the input
variables to a standardized scale.MINMAX— Variables will be scaled between 0 and 1 using the minimum and maximum values of each variable. This is the default.PERCENTILE— Variables will be converted to percentiles between 0 and 1.ZSCORE— Each variable will be standardized by subtracting the mean value and dividing by the standard deviation.RAW— The values of the variables will be used without change.

parameters.name: criteria_score_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies the method that will be used to combine the scaled
variables into a single value.SUM— The values will be added. This is the default.MEAN— The arithmetic (additive) mean of the values will be calculated. This is the default.PRODUCT— The values will be multiplied. All scaled values must be greater than or equal to zero.GEOMETRIC_MEAN— The geometric (multiplicative) mean of the values will be calculated. All scaled values must be greater than or equal to zero.

parameters.name: final_score_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the method that will be used to scale the combined score. This parameter will determine the final score.METHOD_0_1—The final score will be calculated with the lowest value of 0 and the highest value of 1.METHOD_0_100—The final score will be calculated with the lowest value of 0 and the highest value of 100.NONE— The data will not be scaled. This is the default.

tools.summary: Defines parameters for criteria.

parameters.name: in_analysis_layer
parameters.explanation: The Suitability Analysis layer that will be used in the analysis.

parameters.name: target_site_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The layer that contains the target site.

parameters.name: target_site_feature_id(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The feature from the target site layer that will be added to the group layer as the target site.

tools.summary: Adds a target site to a Suitability Analysis group layer. A target site is typically a trade area around a high-performing location, such as a store or clinic. Criteria values in the target site are used to score candidate sites that are closest in value to the target site.

parameters.name: customer_layer
parameters.explanation: A point layer representing customers.

parameters.name: target_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the segments that will be analyzed. The target profile typically represents your customer segmentation profile.

parameters.name: base_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the base profile segments that will be used for comparison. The base profile typically represents your market area segmentation profile.

parameters.name: geography_level
parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the market area gap analysis layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the market area gap analysis.

parameters.name: target_group
parameters.explanation: A collection of segments grouped into targets. Targets represent segments that are selected based on similar characteristics—for example, segments that have high index and percent composition.

parameters.name: core_target
parameters.explanation: A group of segments that make up a large percentage of your customer base and have an above average index, indicating likelihood to be a customer.

parameters.name: developmental_target
parameters.explanation: A group of segments that make up a significant percentage of your customers and of the market area but do not have an above average index.

parameters.name: boundary_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The boundary that determines the layer extent. If no value is provided, the entire country will be used.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a  gap analysis report will be created.CREATE_REPORT—A gap analysis report will be created.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A gap analysis report will not be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format of the output report.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.CSV—The report will be in CSV format.PAGX—The report will be in PAGX format.

tools.summary: Generates a layer that displays the gap between total customers and expected customers. Learn more about Analyze Market Area Gap outputs

parameters.name: target_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the segments that will be analyzed. The target profile typically represents your customer segmentation profile.

parameters.name: base_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the base profile segments that will be used for comparison. The base profile typically represents your market area segmentation profile.

parameters.name: geography_level
parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the market potential layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the market potential analysis.

parameters.name: boundary_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The boundary that determines the layer extent. If no value is provided, the entire country will be used.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a market potential report will be created.CREATE_REPORT—A market potential report will be created.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A market potential report will not be created. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format of the output report.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.CSV—The report will be in CSV format.PAGX—The report will be in PAGX format.

tools.summary: Generates a layer that displays expected customers by a selected geography level. Learn more about Analyze Market Potential outputs

parameters.name: target_group
parameters.explanation: The name of the output target group file.

parameters.name: input_type[input_type,...]
parameters.explanation: Specifies a list of the targets that will be added to the new target group.name—The name of the target.segments—The segments that will be added to the target.color—The color associated with the segment.

tools.summary: Creates a new target group. A target group is a container for targets that you create, name, and populate with segments from a locally installed Business Analyst dataset.

parameters.name: in_profile
parameters.explanation: The segmentation file that will be exported.

parameters.name: out_table_name
parameters.explanation: The name of the table that will be created.

tools.summary: Exports a segmentation profile to a table.

parameters.name: in_customers_layer
parameters.explanation: The input point feature class that represents existing customers.

parameters.name: in_segmentation_base
parameters.explanation: The segmentation base for the profile that will be created. Available options are provided by the segmentation dataset in use.

parameters.name: out_profile
parameters.explanation: The name of the segmentation profile file that will be created.

parameters.name: in_volume_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field containing volume information from which the profile can be created. For example, you can create a profile using the sales for each customer.

tools.summary: Creates a segmentation profile with an existing customer layer.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input feature class with polygon features that will be used to create a segmentation area profile.

parameters.name: segmentation_base
parameters.explanation: The segmentation base for the profile being created. The available options are provided by the segmentation dataset in use.

parameters.explanation: The name of the segmentation profile file that will be created.

tools.summary: Creates a segmentation profile by summarizing segments from standard geography boundaries within the input area.

parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the segments that will be profiled. The target profile typically represents your customer segmentation profile.

parameters.name: base_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the base profile segments. This is the segmentation that will be used for comparison. The base profile typically represents your market area segmentation profile.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format of the output report.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.CSV—The report will be in CSV format.PAGX—The report will be in PAGX format.

tools.summary: Creates a report that displays segments of your customers and compares them to the study area (base profile).

parameters.name: target_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the segments that will be analyzed. The target profile typically represents your customer segmentation profile.

parameters.name: base_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the base profile segments. This is the segmentation used for comparison. The base profile typically represents your market area segmentation profile.

parameters.name: survey_category
parameters.explanation: A category that contains characteristics from the consumer survey.

parameters.name: report_folder
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: sort_column(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the column that will be used to sort the report.EXPECTED_NUMBER—The report will be sorted based on counts—for example, number of adults. This is the default.INDEX—The report will be sorted based on rank.

parameters.name: sort_order(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the order of the report, based on the sort column, in ascending or descending order.ASCENDING—The report will be sorted in ascending order.DESCENDING—The report will be sorted in descending order. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format of the output report.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.CSV—The report will be in CSV format.PAGX—The report will be in PAGX format.

tools.summary: Displays characteristics from the consumer survey data for your target profile to determine customer lifestyle habits and preferences.

parameters.name: target_profile
parameters.explanation: A segmentation profile representing the segments that will be analyzed. The target profile typically represents your customer segmentation profile.

parameters.name: target_group
parameters.explanation: A collection of segments grouped into targets. Targets represent segments that are selected based on similar characteristics, for example, segments that have high index and percent composition.

parameters.name: core_target
parameters.explanation: A group of segments that comprise a large percentage of your customer base and have an above average index, indicating likelihood to be a customer.

parameters.name: developmental_target
parameters.explanation: A group of segments that comprise a significant percentage of your customers and of the market area but do not have an above average index.

parameters.name: report_folder
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: report_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the survey characteristics that will be added to the report.UNDERSTANDING_YOUR_TARGET—Media-related characteristics will be added to the report, for example, reading, watching, and listening related.DEVELOPING_MARKET_STRATEGIES—Leisure-related characteristics will be added to the report, for example, leisure, sports, and travel.CUSTOM— User-defined characteristics will be added to the report. This is the default.

parameters.name: survey_categories[survey_categories,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: A category that contains the characteristics from the consumer survey.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the format of the output report.PDF—The report will be in PDF format. This is the default.XLSX—The report will be in XLSX format.HTML—The report will be in HTML format.CSV—The report will be in CSV format.PAGX—The report will be in PAGX format.

tools.summary: Displays the top characteristics, in each of the selected survey categories, of your Core and Developmental target groups, as well as your overall customer profile.

parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the target layer.

parameters.explanation: The boundary that will determine the layer extent.

parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the target layer.

parameters.name: segmentation_base
parameters.explanation: The segmentation base for the profile being created. The available options are provided by the segmentation dataset in use.

parameters.name: out_feature_class

parameters.explanation: Specifies the target input type.USE_TARGET_GROUP—A target group will be used as the input type.SELECT_SEGMENTS—Segments will be used as the input type. One or more segments can compose a target.

parameters.explanation: The target group, if the dataset supports target groups.

parameters.name: target(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A target from the target_group parameter value.

parameters.name: segments[segments,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The segments from the provided dataset.

parameters.name: boundary_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The boundary that will determine the layer extent.

parameters.name: geography_level
parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the target layer.

parameters.name: segmentation_base
parameters.explanation: The segmentation base for the profile being created. The available options are provided by the segmentation dataset in use.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class for the target layer.

parameters.name: input_type
parameters.explanation: Specifies the target input type.USE_TARGET_GROUP—A target group will be used as the input type.SELECT_SEGMENTS—Selected segments will be used as the input type. One or more segments can compose a target. This is the default.

parameters.name: target_group(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A user-created group of targets. This parameter is used when the dataset supports target groups.

parameters.name: target(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A target from the target_group parameter value.

parameters.name: segments[segments,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The segments from the provided dataset.

parameters.name: boundary_layer(Optional)

parameters.explanation: The input table with segmentation information.

parameters.name: segmentation_base
parameters.explanation: The segmentation base for the profile being created. Available options are provided by the segmentation dataset in use.

parameters.name: out_profile
parameters.explanation: The name of the segmentation file that will be created.

parameters.name: segment_id_field
parameters.explanation: A string field that contains the segmentation code.

parameters.name: count_field
parameters.explanation: A numeric field that contains segment count information.

parameters.name: total_volume_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A numeric field that contains volume information.
