parameters.name: profiles[profiles,...]
parameters.explanation: The categories of survey variables that can be selected for importing as profiles.

parameters.name: out_folder
parameters.explanation: The folder that will contain the imported profiles.

tools.summary: Imports segmentation profiles consisting of survey variable data.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature layer representing customers.

parameters.name: in_store_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature layer representing store or facilities.

parameters.name: store_id_field
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field for in_store_features.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: A point layer containing customers with assigned store or facility and distance.

parameters.name: link_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A new field that contains the assigned store or facility ID.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The method of travel used to calculate the distance between customers and stores.

parameters.name: distance_units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The units that will be used to measure the selected distance type.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel that will be used between stores or facilities and customers.TOWARD_STORES—The direction of travel will be from customers to stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES—The direction of travel will be from stores to customers.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network. Points located beyond the search tolerance will be excluded from processing.The parameter requires a distance value and units for the tolerance. The default value is 5000 meters.

tools.summary: Assigns customers to the closest store based on a selected distance type.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input  polygon feature layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the drive time polygons.

parameters.name: distance_type
parameters.explanation: The method of travel used to create the output polygons.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance units to be used with the threshold values.

parameters.name: in_stores_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A point layer that will be used as the starting point for creating network service areas.

parameters.name: store_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The ID that uniquely identifies each in_stores_layer point.

parameters.name: link_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The ID that uniquely identifies each in_features point.

parameters.name: iterations_limit(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum number of drive times that can be used to find the optimal threshold limit.

parameters.name: minimum_step(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The minimum increment distance or time—for example, 1 mile or 1 min—that will be used between iterations to expand until the threshold is reached.

parameters.name: target_percent_diff(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum difference between the target value and threshold value when determining the threshold drive time, for example, 5 percent. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel toward or away from stores.TOWARD_STORES—  The direction of travel will be toward stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES— The direction of travel will be away from stores.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network.The default value is 5000 meters.

parameters.name: polygon_detail(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the level of detail that will be used for the output drive time polygons.STANDARD—Polygons with a standard level of detail will be created. This is the default.GENERALIZED—Generalized polygons will be created using the hierarchy present in the network data source to produce results quickly.HIGH—Polygons with a high level of detail will be created for applications in which precise results are important.

tools.summary: Creates trade areas that approximate the size, shape, and area of existing polygons using available routes from the selected distance type.

parameters.name: in_stores_layer
parameters.explanation: A point layer representing store or facility locations.

parameters.name: store_id_field
parameters.explanation: The unique ID field representing a store or facility location.

parameters.name: in_customers_layer
parameters.explanation: An input point layer representing customers or patrons.

parameters.name: link_field
parameters.explanation: An ID field that will be used to assign individual customers to stores.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output trade area feature class.

parameters.name: method
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of customer-derived trade area that will be generated.SIMPLE—A generalized trade area based on the percentages of customers corresponding to each store will be generated.AMOEBA—Points representing the boundary of the polygon trade area will be connected using natural curvature.DETAILED—Points representing the boundary of the polygon trade area will be connected using straight lines.DETAILED_WITH_SMOOTHING—Points representing the boundary of the polygon trade area will be connected with smoothed curves using cubic splines. This method takes into account the shape and pattern of the customer distributions.  This is the default.THRESHOLD_RINGS— Concentric rings that expand from input stores until they contain the specified threshold of customers will be generated.THRESHOLD_DRIVETIMES—Polygons that expand from stores along network routes until they contain the specified threshold of customers will be generated.

parameters.name: rings[rings,...]
parameters.explanation: The values that will be used to represent the percentage of customers, for example, total count or a customer attribute and total sales assigned to each store. Each value represents one trade area polygon.

parameters.name: customer_aggregation_type
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of aggregation that will be used.COUNT—Percentage-based trade areas will be calculated using the geographic locations of customers. This is the default.WEIGHT—Percentage-based trade areas will be calculated using a customer attribute, for example, sales.

parameters.name: customer_weight_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used to calculate the trade areas. This is based on either the number of customers (count) or the calculated weighted value assigned to each customer.

parameters.name: exclude_outlying_customers(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether outlying customers will be excluded from the trade area generation.EXCLUDE_OUTLIERS—Outlying customers will be excluded.ALL_POINTS—Outlying customers will not be excluded; all customers will be considered. This is the default.

parameters.name: cutoff_distance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance beyond which customers will be considered outliers and excluded from consideration during trade area generation.

parameters.name: dissolve_option(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether polygons of the entire area will be created or the polygons will be split into individual features. When the method parameter is set to THRESHOLD_DRIVETIMES, the only available option is OVERLAP.OVERLAP— Output polygons will be generated in which each feature begins at zero and grows to satisfy the specified percentage of customers. For example, if you specify a trade area of 50 percent and 70 percent of customers, one polygon will be generated to include 0 to 50 percent and a second polygon will include all 0  to 70 percent of customers. This is the default.SPLIT— Output polygons will be generated for individual features based on the specified percentage breaks. For example, if you specify a trade area of 50 percent and 70 percent of customers, one polygon will be generated to include 0 to 50 percent and a second polygon will include 50 to 70 percent of customers.

parameters.name: use_customer_centroids(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether the centroid of your customer area will be used to calculate trade areas outward from this point.USE_CENTROIDS—The centroid of customer points will be used to calculate trade areas.USE_STORES—The centroid of customer points will not used; store location will be used as the starting point to calculate trade areas. This is the default.

parameters.name: distance_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used to calculate the distance.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The units that will be used for the distance values.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel toward or away from stores.TOWARD_STORES—  The direction of travel will be toward stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES— The direction of travel will be away from stores.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network. Points located beyond the search tolerance will be excluded from processing.This parameter requires a distance value and units for the tolerance.

parameters.name: polygon_detail(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the level of detail that will be used for the output drive time polygons.STANDARD— Polygons with a standard level of detail will be created. This is the default.GENERALIZED—Generalized polygons will be created using the hierarchy present in the network data source to produce results quickly.HIGH— Polygons with a high level of detail will be created for applications in which precise results are important.

parameters.name: iterations_limit(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Restricts the number of drive times that can be used to find the optimal threshold limit.

parameters.name: minimum_step(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The minimum increment distance or time—for example, 1 mile or 1 minute—that will be used between iterations to expand until the threshold is reached.

parameters.name: target_percent_diff(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum percentage difference between the target value and threshold value that will be used when determining the threshold drive time, for example, 5 percent. The default value is 5.

tools.summary: Creates trade areas around stores based on the number of customers or volume attribute of each customer.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the drive time polygons.

parameters.name: distance_type
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used for drive time calculation.

parameters.name: distances[distances,...]
parameters.explanation: The distances that will be used for drive time calculations.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The units that will be used for the distance values. The default value is miles.

parameters.name: id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field for existing facilities.

parameters.name: dissolve_option(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies whether overlapping or nonoverlapping service areas for a single location will be used when multiple distances are specified.
OVERLAP— Each polygon will include the area reachable from the facility up to the distance value. This is the default.SPLIT— Each polygon will include only the area between consecutive distance values.

parameters.name: remove_overlap(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether overlapping concentric rings will be created or overlap will be removed from multiple locations in relation to one another.REMOVE_OVERLAP—Polygons will be split and the overlap between output features will be removed.KEEP_OVERLAP—Output features will be created with overlap. This is the default.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel toward or away from stores.TOWARD_STORES—  The direction of travel will be toward stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES— The direction of travel will be away from stores.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the time_of_day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network. Points located beyond the search tolerance will be excluded from processing.This parameter requires a distance value and units for the tolerance. The default value is 5000 meters.

parameters.name: polygon_detail(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the level of detail that will be used for the output drive time polygons.STANDARD— Polygons with a standard level of detail will be created. This is the default.GENERALIZED—Generalized polygons will be created using the hierarchy present in the network data source to produce results quickly.HIGH— Polygons with a high level of detail will be created for applications in which precise results are important.

parameters.name: input_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of value that will be used for each drive time.VALUES—A constant value will be used (all trade areas will be the same size). This is the default.EXPRESSION— The values from a field or an expression will be used (trade areas can be different sizes).

parameters.name: expression(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A fields-based expression used to calculate drive time.

tools.summary: Creates a feature class of trade areas around point features based on travel time and distance.

parameters.name: geography_level
parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the trade area.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The features that will be used to extract the standard geography level features by the specified spatial relationship. It can be either all features from the layer or only those selected once a selection is available.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used to identify the in_features parameter value—for example, the IDs of drive time polygons.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature containing the trade area.

parameters.name: overlap_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies how the subgeography will be selected from the boundary layer.INTERSECT—If any of the subgeography features touch or intersect the boundary layer, they will be included in the output layer. This is the default.CENTROID_WITHIN—If the centroids of any of the subgeography features are contained within the boundary layer, they will be included in the output layer.
COMPLETELY_WITHIN—Only the features of the subgeography layer that are completely contained within the boundary layer will be included in the output layer.

parameters.name: ratios(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies how percentages will be calculated. The percentages are generated based on how much each geography
intersects the boundary layer and appends the values to the
geography layer.
NO_RATIOS—No percentages will be calculated. This is the default.AREA_ONLY—The percentage will only be calculated for areas of the
geographies that intersect the boundary layer.ALL_RATIOS—The values calculated will contain percentages for Population,
Housing Units, Households, and Business Points.

tools.summary: Generates trade areas from the features of an input standard geography level that has a specified spatial relationship with the input.

parameters.name: geography_level
parameters.explanation: The geography level that will be used to define the trade area.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature containing the trade area.

parameters.name: input_type(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether the geography IDs will be from a table or a list.TABLE—The input IDs will be from a table.LIST—The input IDs will be from a list. This is the default.

parameters.name: in_ids_table(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The input table with IDs that will be used to select geographies that will define the trade area.

parameters.name: geography_key_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A field in the in_ids_table parameter value that identifies the records that will be included in the output.

parameters.name: ids_list(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The input list of comma-separated geography IDs.

parameters.name: summarize_duplicates(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies whether duplicate fields in the table containing
matching geography IDs will be summarized.SUMMARIZE_DUPLICATES—The numeric fields for all duplicate records will be summarized.USE_FIRST—The data of the first record will be appended. Other records will be ignored. This is the default.

parameters.name: group_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The field that will be used to perform a group by operation.

parameters.name: dissolve_output(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether the output will be dissolved based on the group_field parameter value.DISSOLVE—The output will be dissolved.DONT_DISSOLVE—The output will not be dissolved. This is the default.

tools.summary: Creates trade areas based on predefined named statistical areas. This tool does not consume credits.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the drive time polygons.

parameters.name: threshold_variable
parameters.explanation: The selected Business Analyst dataset variable to which the threshold value will be applied.Threshold variables must be numeric. No other statistic type is supported.

parameters.name: threshold_values[threshold_values,...]
parameters.explanation: The threshold variable value that will determine the size of the output rings. The rings will expand until they contain the threshold value of the selected variable.

parameters.name: distance_type
parameters.explanation: The method of travel that will be used to create the output polygons.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance units that will be used with the threshold values.

parameters.name: id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The ID that uniquely identifies each input point and is included in the output as an attribute.

parameters.name: travel_direction(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the direction of travel toward or away from stores.TOWARD_STORES—  The direction of travel will be toward stores. This is the default.AWAY_FROM_STORES— The direction of travel will be away from stores.

parameters.name: time_of_day(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The time and date that will be used when calculating distance.

parameters.name: time_zone(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the time zone that will be used for the Time of Day parameter.TIME_ZONE_AT_LOCATION—The time zone in which the territories are located will be used. This is the default.UTC—Coordinated universal time (UTC) will be used.

parameters.name: search_tolerance(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum distance that input points can be from the network.The default value is 5,000 meters.

parameters.name: polygon_detail(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the level of detail that will be used for the output drive time polygons.STANDARD—Polygons with a standard level of detail will be created. This is the default.GENERALIZED—Generalized polygons will be created using the hierarchy present in the network data source to produce results quickly.HIGH—Polygons with a high level of detail will be created for applications in which precise results are important.

parameters.name: iterations_limit(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Restricts the number of drive times that can be used to find the optimal threshold limit.

parameters.name: minimum_step(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The minimum distance between one threshold area candidate and the next as the model approaches the threshold value to prevent infinite iterations.

parameters.name: target_percent_diff(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum percentage difference between the target value and threshold value that will be used when determining the threshold drive time, for example, 5 percent. The default value is 5.

parameters.name: input_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of value that will be used for each drive time.VALUES—A constant value will be used (all trade areas will be the same size). This is the default.EXPRESSION—The values from a field or an expression will be used (trade areas can be different sizes).

parameters.name: expression(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A fields-based expression that will be used to calculate drive time.

tools.summary: Creates a feature class of network distance trade areas that expand around point features until criteria is reached.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input point feature layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class containing the threshold rings.

parameters.name: threshold_variable
parameters.explanation: The selected Business Analyst dataset variable to which the threshold value will be applied.Threshold variables must be numeric. No other statistic type is supported.

parameters.name: threshold_values[threshold_values,...]
parameters.explanation: The threshold variable value that will determine the size of the output rings. The rings will expand until they contain the threshold value of the selected variable.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distance units that will be used with the threshold values.

parameters.name: id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The ID that uniquely identifies each input point and is included in the output as an attribute.

parameters.name: input_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of value that will be used for each drive time.VALUES—A constant value will be used (all trade areas will be the same size). This is the default.EXPRESSION—The values from a field or an expression will be used (trade areas can be different sizes).

parameters.name: expression(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A fields-based expression that will be used to calculate the radii.

parameters.name: minimum_step(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The minimum distance between one threshold area candidate and the next as the model approaches the threshold value to prevent infinite iterations.

parameters.name: target_percent_diff(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The maximum percentage difference between the target value and threshold value that will be used when determining the threshold drive time, for example, 5 percent. The default value is 5.

tools.summary: Creates a feature class of ring trade areas that expand around point features until the threshold value is reached.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input features containing the center points for the rings.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The feature class that will contain the output ring features.

parameters.name: radii[radii,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The distances, in ascending size, used to create rings around the input features.

parameters.name: units(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The linear unit to be used with the distance values.

parameters.name: id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field in the ring center layer.

parameters.name: remove_overlap(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Creates overlapping concentric rings or removes overlap.REMOVE_OVERLAP—Thiessen polygons are used to remove overlap between output ring polygons.KEEP_OVERLAP—Output ring features are created with overlap. This is the default.

parameters.name: dissolve_option(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies whether overlapping or nonoverlapping service areas for a single location will be used when multiple distances are specified.
OVERLAP—Each polygon will include the area reachable from the facility up to the distance value. This is the default.SPLIT—Each polygon will include only the area between consecutive distance values.

parameters.name: input_method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the type of value that is to be used for each drive time.VALUES—Uses a constant value (all trade areas will be the same size). This is the default.EXPRESSION—The values from a field or an expression (trade areas can be a different size).

parameters.name: expression(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A fields-based expression to calculate the radii.

tools.summary: Creates rings around point locations.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input polygon features that will be analyzed for overlap.

parameters.name: area_id_field
parameters.explanation: The field that uniquely identifies each feature in the input layer.

parameters.name: area_description_field
parameters.explanation: The field that describes each feature in the input layer.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The output feature class that will contain the areas of overlap found in the input layer.

parameters.name: store_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The unique ID that associates a store with each polygon when the inputs are trade areas.

parameters.name: create_report(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether a report will be generated.CREATE_REPORT—A report will be generated.DO_NOT_CREATE_REPORT—A report will not be generated. This is the default.

parameters.name: report_title(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The title of the report. The default value is Measure Cannibalization.

parameters.name: report_folder(Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output location where the report will be saved.

parameters.name: report_format[report_format,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: The output format or formats of the report.

parameters.name: variables[variables,...](Optional)
parameters.explanation: One or more variables that will be used to calculate additional overlap metrics—for example, the total number of people and households in intersection areas, or the percentage of the total number of people and households in a trade area falling into overlapped area.

tools.summary: Calculates the amount of overlap between two or more polygons. Overlap refers to the extent of the polygons beyond intersection. An optional report can be created detailing overlapped statistics.

parameters.name: in_features
parameters.explanation: The input features containing the overlapping polygons.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The feature class containing the new trade area features.

parameters.name: method(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies how the overlap between trade areas will be removed.CENTER_LINE— Overlap will be removed by creating a border that evenly distributes the area of intersection between polygons. This is the default.THIESSEN— Overlap will be removed using straight lines to divide the area of intersection.GRID— Overlap will be removed by creating a grid of parallel lines used to define a natural division between polygons.

parameters.name: define_trade_area(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies whether ring overlap in a trade area will be removed.DEFINE_TRADE_AREA—Overlap will only be removed between polygons with equal values in the ring_id_field parameter.DO_NOT_DEFINE_TRADE_AREA—Overlap will be removed from all intersecting polygons. This is the default.

parameters.name: ring_id_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A field from the input  that defines common trade areas. Overlap between polygons will only be removed if their values in this field are equal.

parameters.name: weight_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A field from the input used to influence removal of overlap based on its values.

parameters.name: store_id(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field in the stores feature layer.

parameters.name: in_stores_layer(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
The input features containing the center points for the overlapping
trade areas.

parameters.name: link_field(Optional)
parameters.explanation: A unique ID field representing a store or facility location.

tools.summary: Removes overlap between two or more areas to form adjacent boundaries.

parameters.name: in_features[in_features,...]
parameters.explanation: The input features containing the overlapping polygons.

parameters.name: out_feature_class
parameters.explanation: The feature class containing the new trade area features.

parameters.name: method(Optional)
parameters.explanation:
Specifies how the overlap between trade areas will be removed.
CENTER_LINE—Overlap will be removed by creating a border that evenly distributes the overlapping area between polygons. This is the simplest method. This is the default.THIESSEN—Overlap will be removed using straight lines to divide the area of intersection. This method uses a series of geometric functions to create nonoverlapping trade areas.GRID—Overlap will be removed by creating a grid of parallel lines used to define a natural division between polygons.

parameters.name: join_attributes(Optional)
parameters.explanation: Specifies the attributes of the input layers that will be transferred to the output.ALL—All attributes from the input features will be transferred to the output feature class. This is the default.NO_FID—All attributes from the input features, except the FID field, will be transferred to the output feature class.ONLY_FID—Only the FID field from the input features will be transferred to the output feature class.

tools.summary: Removes overlap between polygons contained in multiple input layers.
